page.title: 12GEOFFREY'S LEAP
page.content:
Just north of Gorey is a headland known as 'Geoffrey's Leap', sometimes spelt 'Jeffrey', about which there is an interesting legend.
At some time in the 14th or 15th century Geoffrey was convicted of a serious crime against a woman, and his punishment was to be thrown off of this high rock between Gorey and Anne Port. A masked executioner threw him into the sea, some sixty feet below, but despite the huge drop Geoffrey was seen swimming back to the shore. Some of the crowd wanted him thrown over again; others said that he should go free. Geoffrey settled the argument by throwing himself over the cliff again, in a fit of bravado. He struck his head on a rock on the way down, and died.
